name: CleanupCode
help: CleanupCode is a free command-line tool that can perform code cleanup to instantly eliminate code style violations in a project or solution and ensure a uniform code base.

properties.name: Profile
properties.help: Specifies an additional .DotSettings file used for inspection settings.

properties.name: Project
properties.help: Allows analyzing particular project(s) instead of the whole solution. After this parameter, you can type a project name or a wildcard that matches several projects within your solution. For example, <c>--project=*Billing</c>

properties.name: Include
properties.help: relative path(s) that define the files to include during the cleanup.

properties.name: Exclude
properties.help: relative path(s) that define the files to exclude during the cleanup.

properties.name: NoBuiltinSettings
properties.help: Suppresses global, solution and project settings profile usage. Equivalent to using <c>--disable-settings-layers: GlobalAll; GlobalPerProduct; SolutionShared; SolutionPersonal; ProjectShared; ProjectPersonal</c>

properties.name: CachesHome
properties.help: Lets you specify a custom location for the data that CleanupCode caches. By default, the %LOCALAPPDATA% directory is used, unless there are settings files, in which case the one specified there is used. This parameter can be helpful if you want to use a fast SSD disk for the cache or if you want to store all your build processing data in a single place.

properties.name: Extensions
properties.help: Allows using ReSharper extensions that affect code analysis. To use an extension, specify its ID, which you can find by opening the extension package page in the ReSharper Gallery, and then the Package Statistics page. Multiple values are separated with the semicolon.

properties.name: Properties
properties.help: Lets you override MSBuild properties. The specified properties are applied to all analyzed projects. Currently, there is no direct way to set a property to a specific project only. The workaround is to create a custom property in this project and assign it to the desired property, then use the custom property in dupFinder parameters.

properties.name: Toolset
properties.help: Explicitly specified MsBuild Toolset version (12.0, 14.0, 15.0). For example, <c>--toolset=12.0</c>.

properties.name: MonoPath
properties.help: Mono path. Empty to ignore Mono. Not specified for autodetect. Example: <c>--mono=/Library/Frameworks/Mono.framework/Versions/Current/bin/mono.</c>

properties.name: DotNetPath
properties.help: .NET Core path. Empty to ignore .NET Core. Not specified for autodetect. Example: <c>--dotnetcore=/usr/local/share/dotnet/dotnet.</c>
